Nice tsuba, Dirk. I would not call this Kaga work, more likely Yoshiro or simply Heianjo zogan (if not Yoshiro). The kogai hitsuana looks very Kyoto to me. I also think Yoshiro work was "outlined" with chisel marks...not sure about that. (Maybe that was a way to distinguish between Yoshiro and Onin? Suspect Onin work was done that way.) Sorry to be sound so confusing here. Nice overlapping zogan...my guess is Yoshiro. 

Ron
STL
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: dirk marshall 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Saturday, April 23, 2005 1:56 PM
  Subject: [nihontostudy] yoshiro school tsuba?


  I bought this with the other and got a good deal as they were rusty.  I was wondering if this could be a yoshino or kaga tsuba.  As you can see I don't know much other than what I like.  The inlay goes around and on the edge.  

  http://www.freeimagelibrary.com/images/dirkmarshall/leaf.jpg<http://www.freeimagelibrary.com/images/dirkmarshall/leaf.jpg>

  Thanks
  Dirk
